sentences.english: Young men and women must quench their desire to marry early in life.
sentences.chinese: 青年男女一定要剋制早婚的慾望。

sentences.english: Early marriage and procreation are no longer discouraged there.
sentences.chinese: 那裏不再反對早婚早育。

sentences.english: Get married eventually when remnant daughter when, of marring too early already was in basically make a divorce.
sentences.chinese: 當剩女終於出嫁的時候，早婚的基本已在鬧離婚了。

sentences.english: Early marriage fosters the gap between communities and reinforces the cycle of poverty.
sentences.chinese: 早婚造成了社區之間的差距，加強了貧窮的循環。

sentences.english: "If there were any danger in early marriage, Allah would have forbidden it, " a Yemeni member of parliament named Mohammed Al-Hamzi told me in the capital city of Sanaa one day.
sentences.chinese: 如果早婚有危險的話，阿拉會禁止它的。

sentences.english: They also have one of the highest rates of early marriage in the world in Bangladesh.
sentences.chinese: 他們也有在世界上早婚孟加拉國率最高的國家之一。

sentences.english: But public health cannot prevent early marriage.
sentences.chinese: 但公共衛生措施不能避免早婚。

sentences.english: Child marriage spans continents, language, religion, caste.
sentences.chinese: 早婚有地區，語言，宗教，等級因素。

sentences.english: To keep away from sexual temptation, he believed in early marriages.
sentences.chinese: 爲了遠離性誘惑，他相信早婚。

definition: to marry and give birth late
to marry for the second time/second marriage/second spouse
length of married life/marriageable age/actual marrying age
forced marriage/arranged marriage (without the consent of the individuals)
marriage arranged following a pregnancy/marriage necessitated by an unplanned pregnancy
to get married soon after meeting (abbr. for 閃電結婚|闪电结婚[shan3 dian4 jie2 hun1]) (neologism c. 2005)
(of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)
to give birth to a child or children
